page.title: 14WHALTON BAAL FIRE
page.content: The most famous and unique annual event in Whalton is the Baal or Bale Fire. It is held on old midsummer eve, 4th. July. The children of the village collect for and build an enormous bonfire on the the village green just east of the Beresford Arms. Local teams of Morris Men dance in the street before the fire is lit. Recently the Baal Fire has been followed by a Barn Dance in the Village Hall with the proceeds going to the church. Many people believe that the origins of the fire lie in pre-history and are concerned with a pagan god, Baal. However, the Oxford Dictionary states that Bale is derived from the Old English, Bael or the Old Norse, Bal meaning a great fire. During the black_out in the war a few twigs were lit and quickly put out to preserve the tradition.
